name: Get settings tree for the installed executor

in_ports.name: executor_id
in_ports.caption: Executor ID
in_ports.hint: [Optional] Executor ID. If specified, it is used instead of "Executor ID" parameter

out_ports.name: output
out_ports.hint: Full settings tree JSON, or the executor specification if "Build settings tree" is not set

out_ports.name: settings_specification
out_ports.hint: Settings specification JSON section if it exists

out_ports.name: id
out_ports.hint: Settings ID (equal to the "Settings ID" parameter)

out_ports.name: complete
out_ports.hint: Will contain "true" if the tree was completely built, "false" if some sub-settings were not found.

controls.caption: Executor ID
controls.name: id
controls.description: Unique identifier of the executor. Note that it is not the ID of the settings associated with this executor, though they can be equal (for example, for settings combiner executors).

controls.caption: Build settings tree
controls.name: buildTree
controls.description: If set (default behaviour), this function builds JSON with the tree of sub-settings, if any exist. If cleared, this function just returns this executor specification without JSONs of the children.

controls.caption: Smart search
controls.name: smartSearch
controls.description: If set, this function uses the smart algorithm for building settings tree: if settings_id is not specified, it tries to find sub-settings by the control attribute "value_class_name" (if exist) and its name.

controls.caption: Logging level
controls.name: logLevel
controls.description: Logging level when problems occur during smart search.
